total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, fill the entire row and column with the value of the element.
Q3: For each non-zero element, fill the cell with the value of zero if it is not on the row or column of the non-zero element.
Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, fill the entire row and column with the value of the element.
Q3: For each non-zero element, fill the surrounding cells with the value of the element, but leave the cell itself as zero.
Q4: Combine the results from Q2 and Q3 to form the final output grid.
Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, fill the entire row and column with the value of the element.
Q3: For each non-zero element, keep the original value at its position and set the rest of the elements in the row and column to zero.
